intro: Orophea flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellate orophea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters. Orophea flagellaris is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
